intro: Blakwellia montana, commonly known as the mountain blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a central disk of tubular florets. Blakwellia montana is often found in alpine environments and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and seasonal droughts.
